sentences.zh: 太史公曰：五帝、三代之記，尚矣。
sentences.translation: The Grand Historian says: The records of the Five Emperors and Three Dynasties are already ancient.

sentences.zh: 自殷以前諸侯不可得而譜，周以來乃頗可著。
sentences.translation: Before the Yin dynasty, the lords cannot be properly genealogized; from the Zhou onward, they can be quite clearly recorded.

sentences.zh: 孔子因史文次春秋，紀元年，正時日月，蓋其詳哉。
sentences.translation: Confucius arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals based on historical documents, recording the first year, correcting the times, days, and months—how detailed they are!

sentences.zh: 至於序尚書則略，無年月；
sentences.translation: As for the Book of Documents, it is brief, without years or months;

sentences.zh: 或頗有，然多闕，不可錄。
sentences.translation: Some have them to some extent, but many are missing, so they cannot be recorded.

sentences.zh: 故疑則傳疑，蓋其慎也。
sentences.translation: Therefore, where there is doubt, transmit the doubt—this shows his caution.

sentences.zh: 余讀諜記，黃帝以來皆有年數。
sentences.translation: I have read the secret records, and from the Yellow Emperor onward, all have dates.

sentences.zh: 稽其歷譜諜終始五德之傳，古文咸不同，乖異。
sentences.translation: Examining the chronological genealogies and records of the transmission of the Five Virtues from beginning to end, the ancient texts all differ and contradict each other.

sentences.zh: 夫子之弗論次其年月，豈虛哉！
sentences.translation: The Master's not arranging their years and months—was it in vain?

sentences.zh: 於是以五帝系諜、尚書集世紀黃帝以��訖共和為世表。
sentences.translation: Therefore I have made genealogical records of the Five Emperors, collected the centuries of the Book of Documents, from the Yellow Emperor to the Gonghe period, as chronological tables.

sentences.zh: 康王釗刑錯四十餘年。
sentences.translation: King Kang Zhao, punishment weapons stored away for forty years.

sentences.zh: 魯公伯禽 丁公呂伋 晉侯燮 女防 熊乂 微仲，啟弟。
sentences.translation: Duke Boqin of Lu, Duke Ding Lü Ji of Lu, Marquis Xie of Jin, Nüfang, Xiong Yi, Wei Zhong (Qi brother's younger brother).

sentences.zh: 昭王瑕南巡不返。
sentences.translation: King Zhao Xia went on a southern tour and did not return.

sentences.zh: 不赴，諱之。
sentences.translation: Did not arrive, so it was tabooed.

sentences.translation: Xiong Yong

sentences.zh: 張夫子問褚先生曰：「詩言契、后稷皆無父而生。
sentences.translation: Master Zhang asked Master Zhu: "The Odes say that Jie and Hou Ji were both born without fathers.

sentences.zh: 今案諸傳記咸言有父，父皆黃帝子也，得無與詩謬秋？」
sentences.translation: Now examining the various biographies, they all say they had fathers, and their fathers were all sons of the Yellow Emperor—could it be that this contradicts the Odes?"

sentences.zh: 褚先生曰：「不然。
sentences.translation: Master Zhu said: "Not so.

sentences.zh: 詩言契生於卵，后稷人跡者，欲見其有天命精誠之意耳。
sentences.translation: The Odes saying Jie was born from an egg and Hou Ji from a footprint was to show their heavenly mandate and sincere intent.

sentences.zh: 鬼神不能自成，須人而生，柰何無父而生乎！
sentences.translation: Spirits and gods cannot complete themselves; they must be born through humans—how could they be born without fathers!

sentences.zh: 一言有父，一言無父，信以傳信，疑以傳疑，故兩言之。
sentences.translation: One account says they had fathers, another says no fathers; believe what is believable, doubt what is doubtful, therefore both are stated.

sentences.zh: 堯知契、稷皆賢人，天之所生，故封之契七十里，後十餘世至湯，王天下。
sentences.translation: Yao knew Jie and Ji were both worthy men, born of Heaven, so he enfeoffed Jie with seventy li; after more than ten generations came Tang, who became king of the world.

sentences.zh: 堯知后稷子孫之後王也，故益封之百里，其後世且千歲，至文王而有天下。
sentences.translation: Yao knew Hou Ji's descendants would later become kings, so he additionally enfeoffed him with one hundred li; his descendants lasted nearly a thousand years, until King Wen obtained the world.

sentences.zh: 詩傳曰：『湯之先為契，無父而生。
sentences.translation: The Odes tradition says: 'Tang's ancestor was Jie, born without a father.

sentences.zh: 契母與姊妹浴於玄丘水，有燕銜卵墮之，契母得，故含之，誤吞之，即生契。
sentences.translation: Jie's mother was bathing with her sisters at Xuanqiu Water when a swallow carried an egg and dropped it; Jie's mother got it, so she held it, mistakenly swallowed it, and thus gave birth to Jie.

sentences.zh: 契生而賢，堯立為司徒，姓之曰子氏。
sentences.translation: Jie was born and was worthy; Yao established him as Minister of Rites, and surnamed him the Zi clan.

sentences.zh: 子者茲；
sentences.translation: Zi means 'this';

sentences.zh: 茲，益大也。
sentences.translation: 'this' means increasingly great.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「殷社芒芒，天命玄鳥，降而生商」。
sentences.translation: The poets praised and sang of it: 'The Yin altars are vast, Heaven's mandate, the dark bird descends and gives birth to Shang'.

sentences.zh: 商者質，殷號也。
sentences.translation: Shang means solid, Yin is the title.

sentences.zh: 文王之先為后稷，后稷亦無父而生。
sentences.translation: King Wen's ancestor was Hou Ji; Hou Ji was also born without a father.

sentences.zh: 后稷母為姜嫄，出見大人蹟而履踐之，知於身，則生后稷。
sentences.translation: Hou Ji's mother was Jiang Yuan; she went out and saw the footprint of a great man, stepped in it, felt it in her body, and thus gave birth to Hou Ji.

sentences.zh: 姜嫄以為無父，賤而棄之道中，牛羊避不踐也。
sentences.translation: Jiang Yuan thought he had no father, considered him base, and abandoned him in the wilds; oxen and sheep avoided him and did not tread on him.

sentences.zh: 抱之山中，山者養之。
sentences.translation: She carried him to the mountains; the mountains nourished him.

sentences.zh: 又捐之大澤，鳥覆席食之。
sentences.translation: She also abandoned him in the great marsh; birds covered him with their wings and fed him.

sentences.zh: 姜嫄怪之，於是知其天子，乃取長之。
sentences.translation: Jiang Yuan was astonished by this, so she knew he was a son of Heaven, and took him to raise.

sentences.zh: 堯知其賢才，立以為大農，姓之曰姬氏。
sentences.translation: Yao knew his worthy talent and established him as Great Farmer, surnaming him the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 姬者，本也。
sentences.translation: Ji means root.

sentences.zh: 詩人美而頌之曰「厥初生民」，深修益成，而道后稷之始也。』
sentences.translation: The poets praised and sang of it: 'In the beginning he gave birth to the people', deeply cultivating and increasingly completing, thus relating Hou Ji's beginning.'"

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：『昔者堯命契為子氏，為有湯也。
sentences.translation: Confucius said: 'In ancient times Yao commanded Jie to be the Zi clan, because there would be Tang.

sentences.zh: 命后稷為姬氏，為有文王也。
sentences.translation: He commanded Hou Ji to be the Ji clan, because there would be King Wen.

sentences.zh: 大王命季歷，明天瑞也。
sentences.translation: King Tai commanded Ji Li to clarify the heavenly omens.

sentences.zh: 太伯之吳，遂生源也。』
sentences.translation: Tai Bo went to Wu, thus establishing the source.'

sentences.zh: 天命難言，非聖人莫能見。
sentences.translation: Heaven's mandate is difficult to speak of; only sages can perceive it.

sentences.zh: 舜、禹、契、后稷皆黃帝子孫也。
sentences.translation: Shun, Yu, Jie, and Hou Ji were all descendants of the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 黃帝策天命而治天下，德澤深後世，故其子孫皆復立為天子，是天之報有德也。
sentences.translation: The Yellow Emperor grasped Heaven's mandate and governed the world; his virtue and favor ran deep to later generations, therefore his descendants all again became established as Sons of Heaven—this is Heaven's reward for the virtuous.

sentences.zh: 人不知，以為閒從布衣匹夫起耳。
sentences.translation: People do not know this, thinking it happened by chance from commoners rising up.

sentences.zh: 夫布衣匹夫安能無故而起王天下乎？
sentences.translation: How could commoners rise to become kings of the world for no reason?

sentences.zh: 其有天命然。」
sentences.translation: It is because they had Heaven's mandate."

sentences.zh: 「黃帝後世何王天下之久遠邪？」
sentences.translation: "Why did the Yellow Emperor's descendants rule the world for so long?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「傳云天下之君王為萬夫之黔首請贖民之命者帝，有福萬世。
sentences.translation: He said: "The tradition says that rulers of the world who redeem the lives of the common people for ten thousand households become emperors, and have blessings for ten thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 黃帝是也。
sentences.translation: The Yellow Emperor was such a one.

sentences.zh: 五政明則修禮義，因天時舉兵征伐而利者王，有福千世。
sentences.translation: When the five government affairs are clear, cultivate ritual and righteousness, take advantage of heavenly timing to raise troops and attack successfully, become kings with blessings for a thousand generations.

sentences.zh: 蜀王，黃帝後世也，至今在漢西南五千里，常來朝降，輸獻於漢，非以其先之有德，澤流後世邪？
sentences.translation: The King of Shu is a descendant of the Yellow Emperor; even now he is five thousand li southwest of Han, constantly comes to court and submit, offering tribute to Han—isn't this because his ancestors had virtue, with favor flowing to later generations?

sentences.zh: 行道德豈可以忽秋哉！
sentences.translation: Practicing morality—how can it be treated carelessly!

sentences.zh: 人君王者舉而觀之。
sentences.translation: Rulers and kings should take this and observe it.

sentences.zh: 漢大將軍霍子孟名光者，亦黃帝後世也。
sentences.translation: Han General Huo Qubing named Guang is also a descendant of the Yellow Emperor.

sentences.zh: 此可為博聞遠見者言，固難為淺聞者說也。
sentences.translation: This can be spoken of to those with broad knowledge and far sight, but is certainly difficult to explain to those with shallow understanding.

sentences.zh: 何以言之？
sentences.translation: Why say this?

sentences.zh: 古諸侯以國為姓。
sentences.translation: Ancient lords took their states as surnames.

sentences.zh: 霍者，國名也。
sentences.translation: Huo is a state name.

sentences.zh: 武王封弟叔處於霍，後世晉獻公滅霍公，後世為庶民，往來居平陽。
sentences.translation: King Wu enfeoffed his younger brother Shu Chu at Huo; later generations Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Duke Huo, later generations became commoners, coming and going they lived at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 平陽在河東，河東晉地，分為衛國。
sentences.translation: Pingyang is in Hedong; Hedong was Jin territory, divided to become the state of Wei.

sentences.zh: 以詩言之，亦可為周世。
sentences.translation: Speaking of it in terms of the Odes, it can also be considered the Zhou period.

sentences.zh: 周起后稷，后稷無父而生。
sentences.translation: Zhou arose from Hou Ji; Hou Ji was born without a father.

sentences.zh: 以三代世傳言之，后稷有父名高辛；
sentences.translation: Speaking in terms of the Three Dynasties genealogical transmissions, Hou Ji had a father named Gaoxin;

sentences.zh: 高辛，黃帝曾孫。
sentences.translation: Gaoxin was the Yellow Emperor's great-grandson.

sentences.zh: 黃帝終始傳曰：『漢興百有餘年，有人不短不長，出（自）［白］燕之鄉，持天下之政，時有嬰兒主，欲行車。』
sentences.translation: The Yellow Emperor's chronological record says: 'After Han had arisen more than one hundred years, there was a man neither short nor tall, coming from the region of Yan, holding the world's government, at a time when there was an infant ruler, wanting to drive the carriage.'

sentences.zh: 霍將軍者，本居平陽（自）［白］燕。
sentences.translation: General Huo originally lived in Pingyang, from the Yan region.

sentences.zh: 臣為郎時，與方士考功會旗亭下，為臣言。
sentences.translation: When I was a gentleman attendant, I met the fangshi Kao Gong under the banner pavilion, and he told me this.

sentences.zh: 豈不偉哉！」
sentences.translation: Wasn't it magnificent!"
